result.execSummary:
The defendant Durome C Verse was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including Alcohol and Drug counseling and Domestic violence counseling. No VIOLENT contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  

***Deft is ordered to provide a DNA specimen prior being released from jail***

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Durome C Verse

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served
Pre-Trial Conference and Order/case adjourned off the record.
Status conference on August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 9, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No violent contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Durome C Verse in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Durome C Verse in custody.  Noah Michael Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
